page.title: 01A GENERAL VIEW
page.content: In our block there are two villages: Swaffham Bulbeck and Lode with Longmeadow which rise out of flat,rich fields.In these arable fields the main crops grown are wheat and barley.The villages are quite small.There are about 700 people in Swaffham Bulbeck. In recent years more and more people who commute to Cambridge to work have moved into these farming villages.Life is changing and will continue to change. Each village now has one shop/post office,hairdresser,church, chapel and primary school.Lode has recently lost one of its two pubs and is about to lose its school. Running North from the villages are ancient waterways called lodes.Apart from some rising chalk land on the extreme East of our block the raised banks of the lodes are the highest points on the fen landscape.
